thread.title: Snooker Shoot-out controversy: Ref robs Gilbert of chance of £32,000 as he 'couldn't hear'
thread.title_full: Snooker Shoot-out controversy: Ref robs Gilbert of chance of £32,000 as he 'couldn't hear'

title: Snooker Shoot-out controversy: Ref robs Gilbert of chance of £32,000 as he 'couldn't hear'
text:
“There was a time foul, massively” David Gilbert 
The commentators on the ITV 4 team recognised the blunder immediately and said: "There was a time foul. Dear oh dear." 
But ref Rob Spence lets the Chinese player continue, to which the commentator added: "Could there be controversy on the way? It seems like Xiao struck the cue ball after the clok hit zero 
"It was the noise from the yellow brigade and the referee didn't hear the beeps." 
Spence should have called a foul, awarded Gilbert the four points and given him ball in hand. 
ITV 
ITV There was a clear time foul 
It would have almost certainly handed him the frame on a plate and the chance to move into the final, where the winner banks £32,000. 
A visibly annoyed Gilbert confronted Spence at the end of the game and told him: "There was a time foul, massively." 
But the stunned ref replied: "I couldn't hear." 
Gilbert graciously walked off with no further argument. Related articles
